intro: Hieracium basalticola, commonly known as the basaltic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often found in mountainous areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium basalticola is adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient and specialized species.
